security: Revealing accommodation addresses could expose the identities and activities of S/ agents operating in the MEXI area, potentially compromising their safety and effectiveness. This could also hinder ongoing intelligence operations and damage the CIA's ability to gather information in the region.
summary: A classified message from Mexico City provides three accommodation addresses for use by S/ agents in the MEXI area, with a request to advise on remaining addresses soonest.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET classified message, dated January 26, 1961, originates from the CIA station in Mexico City (MEXI) and is addressed to BELL, with informational copies to COP, ADDP/A, WH, and BELL S/c. The message provides three accommodation addresses (Armando B. Sanchez, Berta A. Martinez, and Antonio Busto) to be used by S/ agents operating in the MEXI area, referencing a previous communication (BELL 6767) and indicating that further addresses will be advised soon. A comment indicates that Headquarters (HQS) needed accommodation addresses in the MEXI area for S/ agents.
title: Accommodation Addresses for S/ Agents in Mexico City
